projects.title: Cybersecurity Solutions – INCIBE
projects.company: Mnemo, client INCIBE (Spanish National Cybersecurity Institute)
projects.description: Worked as a fullstack developer in the cybersecurity field for INCIBE, through the consulting firm Mnemo. Contributed to the design, development, and maintenance of secure web applications focused on threat intelligence and cybersecurity awareness. My tasks included backend development with Java (Spring Boot, JPA, Hibernate) and Python (FastAPI), as well as frontend work using Angular and TypeScript. I implemented RESTful APIs, CI/CD pipelines, and participated in agile sprints, with a strong focus on code quality and security. This role required high attention to detail due to the critical nature of the public services involved.

projects.title: Eat-Me: Augmented Reality Menu App
projects.description: Designed and developed Eat-Me, an augmented reality application that allows restaurants to showcase their menu items in an innovative way using the customer's mobile phone. By pointing to a visual marker on the table, diners can view realistic 3D models of the dishes before ordering. The project was created for the HORECA sector and received recognition from the Basque Culinary Center. The app was published on Google Play and the App Store, with backend services and model hosting managed via AWS.

projects.title: PRISMA – Scientific Research Platform at the University of Seville
projects.rol: Data extraction and cleaning automation with Python. Frontend web development and integration support for scientific research data.
projects.description: Collaborated in the development and enhancement of PRISMA (https://prisma.us.es/), a web platform that centralizes and organizes the scientific output of the university’s faculty and researchers. Tasks included collecting, cleaning, and structuring data from multiple sources and formats (CSV, Excel, XML, JSON), as well as automating the extraction of additional data using web scraping with Python. Used Pandas to prepare structured datasets for further analysis. Contributed to frontend implementation using HTML5, JavaScript, and PHP, building an accessible interface for querying publications, theses, projects, and associated metrics. The platform supports CV generation (CVN/CVA) and increases the visibility of scientific work in funding applications (FECYT, National Plan, Instituto Carlos III).

projects.title: Automated Work Hour Tracking System
projects.description: Developed software that allows companies to maintain accurate and automated tracking of employee working hours, both onsite and remotely. The tool includes functionality for assigning hours to specific tasks or projects, enabling up-to-date cost center tracking based on time allocation. This system helps improve operational efficiency and internal financial control.

projects.title: Instagram Automation Script and Social Media Management Tool
projects.description: Innovative tool designed to support Community Management teams by automating content creation and social media management for Instagram. The script generates personalized content using advanced algorithms that consider audience demographics and preferences. It creates posts, captions, and visual proposals aligned with brand identity. It also includes features like automatic messaging, scheduled replies, and a publication calendar for efficient planning.

projects.title: Functional Test Automation and Security Audits for Banks
projects.description: As a QA Tester at Sopra Steria, I worked on banking projects designing and executing functional test cases, developing process automation scripts, and conducting security audits through manual testing and automated scans. Contributed to ensuring software quality, improving testing efficiency, and identifying critical vulnerabilities in banking systems.

projects.title: Support Project for Systemic Treatment and Radiotherapy Dosing
projects.company: Virgen del Rocío University Hospital, Seville
projects.description: Participated in a project funded by the Instituto de Salud Carlos III focused on treatments for lung cancer patients. Assisted in the study and analysis of hospital data related to chemotherapy and radiotherapy patients. Reorganized an unstructured free-text database into a well-designed relational model. Structured the data to allow for more efficient queries, facilitating clinical studies and patient follow-up. Applied basic data mining techniques in a hospital setting. Also developed a WordPress platform for centralized content management of various innovation group projects.
